original_text:
DISCHARGE SUMMARY
**INSTITUTION
**PLACE , PA **ZIP-CODE
**NAME[AAA , BBB]
**ID-NUM
**ID-NUM
A5B/539
SERVICE OF :
**NAME[ZZZ]
**NAME[YYY]
DATE OF ADMISSION :
**DATE[Jul 16 2007]
DATE OF DISCHARGE :
**DATE[Jul 19 2007]
DISCHARGE DIAGNOSES :
1. Acute alcoholic hepatitis .
2. Portal hypertension .
3. Ascites status post paracentesis of 2.5 L .
4. Blood coagulation started due to liver disease .
5. Alcohol abuse .
6. Leukocytosis - resolved .
7. Delusional hyponatremia .
8. History of lone atrial fibrillation .
9. Benign essential hypertension .
10. Diabetes mellitus type 2 in obese male - controlled .
HOSPITAL COURSE :
This is a **AGE[in 30s]-year-old male who presented with increased abdominal girth associated with no shortness of breath .
He had been at home drinking fluids trying to flush his system .
He was strongly encouraged to come in by his mother and was admitted through the emergency room .
On date of admission , the patient 's sodium was 134 , his chloride was 98 , CO2 28 , BUN 5 , creatinine 0.06 with a glucose of 104 .
His LFTs showed total protein of 7.7 , total bilirubin of 4.5 , direct bilirubin of 2.5 , ALT of 78 , AST of 213 , alkaline phosphatase of 113 with a lipase of 242 .
The patient 's CBC showed a WBC count of 21.1 , hemoglobin 12.7 , hematocrit of 36.8 , and MCV of 105 , MCH of 36.3 with platelets of 177 .
His PT was 21.2 with an INR of 1.8 and his PTT was 42.8 .
His UA showed bilirubin , trace ketones , positive nitrites , and positive protein .
X-rays showed chest x-ray with some minor right lower lobe atelectasis .
His abdominal CT showed progressive cirrhotic change within the liver with new evidence of portal hypertension including large abdominal ascites , perigastric , and paraesophageal varices , and reconstituted periumbilical vein .
He also had sigmoid diverticula without evidence for acute diverticulitis .
The patient was admitted for acute alcoholic hepatitis .
He had a GI evaluation with Dr. **NAME[TTT] who consulted the hepatologist Dr. **NAME[SSS RRR] at **PHONE regarding Mr. **NAME[AAA] .
He was thought to be a candidate for steroid therapy and Trental .
Steroids are a double-edged sword , however , and we need to be vigilant regarding infection control and with this patient 's glucose control as he is diabetic .
Dr. **NAME[RRR] will be happy to follow the patient at **INSTITUTION .
Other recommendations are the patient will have a paracentesis with cell count , C and S , and total protein which has been done , 2.5 L was removed from the patient .
The fluid removed was yellow clear in color .
There were 139 WBC s , there were 99 RBC s , 1 neutrophil , 2 lymphs , 48 monos , and 37 mesothelial cells , 12 macrophages .
The fluid albumin was 0.6 and total protein of 0.7 .
He had a urine C and S which was detailed as above .
The culture is currently no growth times 2 days .
A nasal swab , which has been done .
The patient will be ready for insulin therapy if needed during his course of steroids .
He will need q.i.d. glucose monitoring , sliding scale , and close follow up with PCP or endocrine .
A diabetic educator has been consulted for patient , they have instructed the patient .
He does have two monitors at home and he says old glucometer strips .
The patient will see endocrine before discharge .
He will start prednisone 40 mg per day x 4 weeks , then 1 week rapid taper as outlined by Dr. **NAME[TTT] 's note .
The prednisone will be started with his PCP Dr. **NAME[UUU] .
We would like to see that the patient is at least willing to follow up with Dr. **NAME[UUU] before starting prednisone therapy .
He will be discharged on Trental 400 mg t.i.d.
Since the patient 's total protein in the ascites was less than 1 we will start him on Cipro 750 mg p.o. weekly x 4 weeks for his [_______________]*** prophylaxis .
His weekly labs will include a CBC , LFT s , PT , INR , lytes , BUN , creatinine , and glucose .
He should have a physician visit weekly without fail between his PCP Dr. **NAME[UUU] and the hepatologist Dr. **NAME[RRR] .
If his WBC count increases on steroids he should have a blood culture , urine C and S every week .
The patient has a 50% mortality risk the next month .
We have instructed the patient the importance of alcohol cessation .
He is adamant against acute inpatient rehabilitation .
He has had this in the past and has not worked and he is very much against outpatient rehabilitation , although , he is now willing to consider it after we have spoken to the patient at length .
We have instructed that he follow up with Dr. **NAME[UUU] .
He has made an appointment and the following week he should follow up with Dr. **NAME[RRR] and Dr. **NAME[TTT] as needed .
This is a very nice patient .
I hope that he can be compliant .
I will send him out on Librium as needed for alcohol withdrawal .
If he needs further Librium then he should go to **INSTITUTION Ambulatory Division for further care .
Laboratory studies on discharge :
Sodium 133 , potassium 4.1 , chloride 101 , CO2 28 , BUN 7 , creatinine 0.5 , and glucose 99 .
Albumin of 1.4 , total protein of 6.3 , total bilirubin of 3.8 , direct bilirubin 2.0 , ALT 65 , AST 167 , and alkaline phosphatase 117 .
His iron was 123 .
His TIBC was greater than 123 , but less than 143 .
His iron saturation was greater than 87% .
His ferritin was 1530 .
His vitamin B12 was 1838 .
His folic acid was 5.7 .
He had triglycerides on **DATE[May 8 2006] , of 112 .
His WBC count on **DATE[Jul 19 2007] , was 10.5 , hemoglobin 10.6 , hematocrit 30.5 , and MCV 105.2 , and platelets 162 .
His PT was 19.9 with an INR of 1.7 , PTT of 45.3 on **DATE[Jul 18 2007] .
His hemoglobin A1c on **DATE[Jul 17 2007] , was 5.3 .
His hepatitis panel was nonreactive .
MRSA screen showed no MRSA isolated at 1 day .
Body fluid culture showed few WBCs on Gram-stain .
No organisms seen .
He had no growth x 1 day .
His blood cultures no growth x 2 days and urine cultures no growth x 2 days and this is the final report .
The patient 's paracentesis results are already dictated as above .
DISCHARGE MEDICATIONS :
1. Folic acid 1 mg p.o. daily .
2. Lisinopril 40 mg p.o. daily .
3. Milk of magnesia 30 mL p.o. at bedtime for constipation .
4. Multivitamin 1 p.o. daily .
5. Nicotine 21 mg patch topically daily for nicotine withdrawal .
Do not take while continuing to smoke .
6. Trental 400 mg p.o. t.i.d.
7. Spironolactone 100 mg p.o. daily .
8. Thiamine 100 mg p.o. daily .
9. Librium 25 mg one p.o. q.i.d. as needed for alcohol withdrawal .
The patient was instructed on absolutely no alcohol use .
He is 1800 - calorie diabetic , 1000 mL fluid restriction , 2 g sodium diet .
Absolutely no driving .
The patient does not have his driver 's license currently .
He is to see Dr. **NAME[UUU] on Tuesday at 1:30 p.m.
He is to see Dr. **NAME[RRR] the second week .
He was given a script for blood work .
Results to Dr. **NAME[UUU] , Dr. **NAME[RRR] , and Dr. **NAME[TTT] , and he is to go to **INSTITUTION ER Ambulatory Detox Unit for Librium refill as needed .
___________________
**NAME[WWW M. XXX] , D.O.
Dict : **DATE[Jul 19 2007] 15:34:50
Tran : **DATE[Jul 19 2007] 23:31:43
**INITIALS
R : **DATE[Jul 19 2007] 23:31:43 /
**CARBON-COPY
